item.title: Katherine add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I lay on the bed and lost myself in stories. I liked that. Books were safer than other people anyways." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Pat Tillman
item.description: "I think I understand that religious faith which makes the holy brave and strong; my strength is just somewhere else--it's in myself...I do not fear what may await me, though I'm equally confident that nothing awaits." -- Pat Tillman

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Sara Gruen
item.description: "Keeping up the appearance of having all your marbles is hard work, but important." -- Sara Gruen

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Sara Gruen
item.description: "The more distressing the memory, the more persistent it's presence. " -- Sara Gruen

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Sara Gruen
item.description: "With a secret like that, at some point the secret itself becomes irrelevant. The fact that you kept it does not." -- Sara Gruen

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Jon Krakauer
item.description: "When a young person is moved by a passion and feels compelled to go on this sort of quest, I think you have to let him. You can't stop him. In our culture we don't have formal rights of passage like in some ancient cultures. Subjecting yourself to risk... may be something you have to go through to be a man or a woman." -- Jon Krakauer

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Ken Kesey
item.description: "To hell with facts! We need stories!" -- Ken Kesey

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Ken Kesey
item.description: "Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing." -- Ken Kesey

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Ken Kesey
item.description: "People think love is an emotion. Love is good sense." -- Ken Kesey

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Jeannette Walls
Katherine add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "It is the peculiar nature of the world to go on spinning no matter what sort of heartbreak is happening." -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "Oh, please don't go—we'll eat you up—we love you so!" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "And now," cried Max, "let the wild rumpus start!" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "And Max, the king of all wild things, was lonely and wanted to be where someone loved him best of all." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "And the wild things roared their terrible roars and gnashed their terrible teeth and rolled their terrible eyes and showed their terrible claws." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He never went out without a book under his arm, and he often came back with two." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Oh, monsters are scared," said Lettie. "That's why they're monsters." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I was a normal child. Which is to say, I was selfish and I was not entirely convinced of the existence of things that were not me, and I was certain, rock-solid, unshakeably certain, that I was the most important thing in creation. There was nothing that was more important to me than I was." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Different people remember things differently, and you'll not get any two people to remember anything the same, whether they were there or not." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Nobody looks like what they really are on the inside. You don’t. I don’t. People are much more complicated than that. It’s true of everybody." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Grown-ups don't look like grown-ups on the inside either. Outside, they're big and thoughtless and they always know what they're doing. Inside, they look just like they always have. Like they did when they were your age. Truth is, there aren't any grown-ups. Not one, in the whole wide world." -- Neil Gaiman
